httpy

A Python lightweight socket-based library to create HTTP(s) connections.

Features

  • Cookies support

  • Caching support

  • Easy debugging

  • HTTP authentication

  • Form support

Requirements

  • Python>=3.6

Usage

It’s easy.

1import httpy
2resp = httpy.request("https://example.com/") # Do a request
3resp.content #Access content

API Documentation

Examples

POST method

Simple Form

1import httpy
2resp = httpy.request("https://example.com/", method="POST", body = {"foo":"bar"})
3# ...

Sending files

1import httpy
2resp = httpy.request("https://example.com/", method = "POST", body = { "foo" : "bar", "file" : httpy.File.open( "example.txt" ) })
3# ...

Sending binary data

1import httpy
2resp = httpy.request("https://example.com/", method = "POST", body= b" Hello, World ! ")
3# ...

Sending plain text

1resp = httpy.request("https://example.com/", method = "POST", body = "I support Ünicode !")
2# ...

Sending JSON

1resp = httpy.request("https://example.com/", method = "POST", body = "{\"foo\" : \"bar\" }", content_type = "application/json")
2# ...

Debugging

Just set debug to True :

>>> import httpy
>>> httpy.request("https://example.com/",debug=True)

send:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, identity
Host: example.com
User-Agent: httpy/1.0.2
Connection: keep-alive

response: 
HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Content-Encoding: gzip
Age: 587058
Cache-Control: max-age=604800
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Date: Wed, 06 Apr 2022 11:01:09 GMT
Etag: "3147526947+ident+gzip"
Expires: Wed, 13 Apr 2022 11:01:09 GMT
Last-Modified: Thu, 17 Oct 2019 07:18:26 GMT
Server: ECS (dcb/7F18)
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Cache: HIT
Content-Length: 648
<Response [200 OK] (https://example.com/)>
